data.title: With Trump’s win, some women wonder: Will the US ever see a female president?
data.description: In this election, voters had the chance to shatter the highest glass ceiling in American politics by electing Kamala Harris as the first female president. Instead, they re-elected Donald Trump, who made a comeback with strong—and even slightly improved—support from women.

data.title: Kelantan proposes constructing wall along Malaysia-Thailand border
data.description: KOTA BHARU: The Kelantan government will propose to the federal government to build a wall along the Malaysia-Thailand border near the state.

data.title: Strategic support for Thai Government to boost tourism
data.description: Grab supports the Thai government’s initiative to enhance tourism through the “Amazing Thailand Grand Tourism Year 2025” campaign.

data.title: From space missions to smart factories
data.description: Personal computers, GPS, mobile phones, digital cameras, the internet: many of the technologies in our lives today are older than we might think. They originate from concepts from the 1960s and 70s - an enormously creative, innovative period.

data.title: Unocha: Over one-third of Myanmar's population urgently needs humanitarian aid
data.description: According to a statement from Unocha, more than a third of the country’s population urgently requires humanitarian aid, especially food, shelter, clean water, and healthcare, due to ongoing armed conflicts.

data.title: From space missions to smart factories
data.description: Personal computers, GPS, mobile phones, digital cameras, the internet: many of the technologies in our lives today are older than we might think. They originate from concepts from the 1960s and 70s - an enormously creative, innovative period.

data.title: Over one-third of Myanmar's population urgently needs humanitarian aid amid conflict and displacement, says UNOCHA
data.description: According to a statement from UNOCHA, more than a third of the country’s population urgently requires humanitarian aid, especially food, shelter, clean water, and healthcare, due to ongoing armed conflicts.

data.title: Lhasa residents unite to paint Potala Palace in annual tradition
data.description: Over the last week, thousands of residents of Lhasa have joined the work of painting the exterior walls of the Potala Palace, an annual routine "makeover" project for the UNESCO World Heritage site.

data.title: From pink to green
data.description: In the heart of Thailand

data.title: 'Million Gifts, Million Smiles' returns to help kids in the South
data.description: For more than two decades, the turmoil in the southern border provinces has persisted, significantly impacting the mental well-being of numerous children and young people.

data.title: CentralWorld hosts YWCA Diplomatic Charity Bazaar
data.description: CentralWorld has been transformed into an international Christmas market featuring premium gifts from around the world for the 69th YWCA Diplomatic Charity Bazaar, which kicks off today and runs until Sunday.

data.title: Thai energy agency makes strong case for OCA development
data.description: The Energy Policy and Planning Office (EPPO) has suggested that the development of gas resources from the Overlapping Claims Area (OCA) could play a crucial role in stabilising Thailand's energy market.

data.title: Experts call on Thai govt to prioritise OCA negotiations with Cambodia
data.description: Energy experts have called on the Thai government to prioritise negotiations with Cambodia to settle the Overlapping Claims Area (OCA) in the Gulf of Thailand.

data.title: Record Loy Krathong spending won’t offset economic problems: UTCC
data.description: The University of the Thai Chamber of Commerce (UTCC) said that while spending during the Loy Krathong festival is expected to exceed 10 billion baht, it is unlikely to have a significant impact on the economy.

data.title: Thai Airways union, creditors push back against proposed govt control
data.description: The Thai Airways labour union and the airline’s creditors have voiced strong opposition to a proposed amendment that seeks to add two government officials as its business rehabilitation plan administrators.

data.title: Donald Trump elected US president in stunning comeback
data.description: Donald Trump was elected president, capping a remarkable comeback four years after he was voted out of the White House and ushering in a new American leadership likely to test democratic institutions at home and relations abroad.

data.title: Chadchart lauds US system for letting elected leaders complete their term
data.description: This is something Thailand can learn from, says Bangkok governor

data.title: Maris issues clarification on maritime boundary talks with Cambodia
data.description: Any agreement must be approved by parliaments of both countries, he says

data.title: Shopee, Lazada agree to remove illegal food products in 24 hours
data.description: The e-commerce platforms have agreed to comply with the Thai FDA to remove all unregistered food products and take swift action against violators within 24 hours

data.title: Police break up late-night brawl between Uzbekistani women in Pattaya
data.description: Pattaya broke up a violent turf war among freelance sex workers and later freed them without charges after both sides agreed to forgive each other

data.title: Paetongtarn bans ISOC officials from receiving gifts
data.description: PM says the force lays emphasis on preventing corruption
